title: Heading
excerpt: A heading component is used to display heading as a heading or title. It comes in various sizes and styles to help users quickly identify the most important information on a page.

body.raw:
## Props ### size - Type: string - Default: `md` - Options: `2xs` | `xs` | `sm` | `md` | `lg` | `xl` | `2xl` The size prop controls the size of the heading. The following values are valid: Example: ```tsx showLineNumbers title="Heading.tsx" Some heading. Some heading. Some heading. Some heading. Some heading. Some heading. ``` ### weight:`thin` |`extra-light` |`light` |`normal` |`medium` |`bold` |`extra-bold` The weight prop controls the weight (boldness) of the heading. The following values are valid: Example: ```tsx showLineNumbers title="Heading.tsx" Some heading. Some heading. Some heading. Some heading. Some heading. ``` Example: ```tsx showLineNumbers title="Heading.tsx" Some important heading. ``` ### weight:`thin` |`extra-light` |`light` |`normal` |`medium` |`bold` |`extra-bold` The truncate prop with the value of "multiline" will truncate the heading if it exceeds the specified numberLine prop value and will display an ellipsis at the end of the last visible line. On the other hand, if the truncate prop value is "singleline", it will truncate the heading to fit within a single line and display an ellipsis at the end of the truncated heading. truncate (optional): Determines whether the heading should be truncated and how it should be truncated. If the value is "singleline", the heading will be truncated to fit within a single line and display an ellipsis at the end of the truncated heading. If the value is "multiline", the heading will be truncated if it exceeds the specified numberLine prop value and display an ellipsis at the end of the last visible line. Example: ```tsx showLineNumbers title="Heading.tsx" export function HeadingTrucates() { return (

It can take one of the following values: - start: The heading is aligned to the left (default). - center: The heading is centered horizontally. - end: The heading is aligned to the right. Example: ```tsx showLineNumbers title="Heading.tsx" export function HeadingAligns() { return (

The available options are: red, brown, purple, secondary, green, orange, primary, and surface. The contrast prop sets the contrast level between the heading and the background color. When contrast is set to "high", the heading has a higher contrast with the background, making it easier to read, while when contrast is set to "low", the heading has lower contrast with the background, which can make it more difficult to read the default is `high`. Example: ```tsx showLineNumbers title="Heading.tsx" export function HeadingColors() { return (

This prop accepts four different values: "normal", "sm", "md", and "lg" Example ```tsx showLineNumbers title="Heading.tsx" This heading has a normal line height. This heading has a small line height. This heading has a medium line height. This heading has a large line height. ``` By using the leading prop, you can easily adjust the line height of your heading to create a more visually appealing design. ### dir For RTL language Support "dir": This prop sets the direction of the heading within the component. It accepts the values "rtl" for right-to-left direction or "ltr" for left-to-right direction. This prop is useful when displaying heading in languages that are read from right to left, such as Arabic or Hebrew. ```tsx showLineNumbers title="Heading.tsx" export function HeadingRTL() { return (
مُرَاكُش اموراكوش، «أرض الله») تسمى أيضًا بالمدينة الحمراء وعاصمة النخيل، هي ثالث أكبر مدينة في المملكة المغربية من ناحية عدد السكان. وهي عاصمة جهة مراكش آسفي. تقع مراكش على بعد 580 كم (360 ميل) جنوب شرق طنجة، 327 كم (203 ميل) جنوب شرق العاصمة المغربية الرباط، 239 كم (149 ميل) جنوب شرق الدار البيضاء، و 246 كم (153 ميل) شمال شرق أكادير. ללמוד לקוד זה אחד הדברים הכי טובים שאני עושה כל חיי ކޯޑް ކުރަން ދަސްކުރުމަކީ އަހަރެންގެ މުޅި އުމުރުގައި ވެސް ކުރި އެންމެ ރަނގަޅު ކަމެކެވެ
) } ``` ## Use Case The Heading component can be used to display heading in various sizes and weights. ## Implementation details The Heading component is implemented using JSX and styled with CSS. ## Accessibility The Heading component uses semantic HTML elements and provides an aria-label attribute when necessary to ensure accessibility. ## TypeScript Support The Heading component has full TypeScript support. ## Troubleshooting If the heading is not displaying as expected, make sure that the correct props are being used and that any necessary styles are applied. ## Conclusion The Heading component is a versatile component that can be used to display heading in various sizes and weights with full accessibility and TypeScript support.
